column1: Question
column9: Tips

column1: Tell me about yourself.
column9: Give brief background on who you are. Highlight some relevant experience. Explain why you are here (at the specific interview).

column1: Describe a major change that occurred in a job that you held. How did you adapt to this change?
column9: Situation Action Response. Describe the job atmostphere. Talk about the change. Explain your response and how you adapted.

column1: Tell us about a situation in which you had to adjust to changes over which you had no control. How did you handle it?
column9: Situation  Action Response. Describe the situation. Talk about the change. Explain your response and how you adapted.

column1: Tell us about a time that you had to adapt to a difficult situation.
column9: Situation  Action Response. Describe the situation. Talk about what you did. Explain the effects of your actions.

column1: What do you do when priorities change quickly? Give one example of when this happened.
column9: Make sure you are specific in your response. Demonstrate how you are able to adapt to changes.

column1: Describe a project or idea that was implemented primarily because of your efforts. What was your role? What was the outcome?
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Describe a time when you made a suggestion to improve the work in your organization.
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Tell us about a time when you had to go above and beyond the call of duty in order to get a job done.
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Give an example of an important goal that you set in the past. Tell about your success in reaching it.
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Describe the project or situation which best demonstrates your analytical abilities. What was your role?
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Developing and using a detailed procedure is often very important in a job. Tell about a time when you needed to develop and use a detailed procedure to successfully complete a project.
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Give a specific example of a time when you used good judgment and login in solving a problem.
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Give me a specific example of a time when you used good judgment and logic in solving a problem.
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Give a specific example of a time when you had to address an angry customer. What was your role and what was the outcome?
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Tell us about a time when you built rapport quickly with someone under difficult conditions.
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: What, in your opinion, are the key ingredients in guiding and maintaining successful business relationships? Give examples of how you made these work for you.
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Tell me about a time when you were not able to build a successful relationship with a difficult person.
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Describe a situation in which you were able to effectively "read" another person and guide your actions by your understanding of their individual needs or values.
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Describe a situation when you were able to strengthen a relationship by communicating effectively. What made your communication effective?
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Describe a situation where you felt you had not communicated well. How did you correct the situation?
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.

column1: Describe a time when you were able to effectively communicate a difficult or unpleasant idea to a superior.
column9: Situation  Action Reponse. Start with your idea and why you had that idea. Then talk about how you executed the idea. Finally talk about the results.
